notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to gain unauthorized access to configuration files or obtain sensitive information.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Commercial Facilities, Critical Manufacturing, Energy, Water
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: NCCIC recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS-CERT website in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities.
notes.title: Exploitability

revision_history.summary: ICSA-18-249-01 Ice Qube Thermal Management Center

product.name: Thermal Management Center: all versions prior to 4.13

notes.text: The web application does not properly authenticate users, which may allow an attacker to gain access to sensitive information.CVE-2017-14026 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.6 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Ice Qube recommends that users of affected versions upgrade to the latest version of Thermal Management Center v4.13 or newer, which can be obtained by contacting Technical Support at the following email: service@iceqube.com or by calling Technical Support at: 724-837-7600.

notes.text: Passwords are stored in plaintext in a file that is accessible without authentication.CVE-2017-16714 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.6 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Ice Qube recommends that users of affected versions upgrade to the latest version of Thermal Management Center v4.13 or newer, which can be obtained by contacting Technical Support at the following email: service@iceqube.com or by calling Technical Support at: 724-837-7600.
